title: Conrad Sweynheym and Arnold Pannartz example?
content:
Hello everybody,

for a schoolproject I want to write an articel about blackletter and its evolution. Therefor I wanted to show an example of the works of Conrad Sweynheym and Arnold Pannartz and their Gotico-Antiqua, but I cant find any printable example of it which i could use for it! :( I hope that anyone of you could help me, where I could find it

thank you, and best regards: Steven
author: Steven Wulf

comments.content: I assume their Subiaco type is appearing toward the end of your essay?

Doh!

I am so blind!

I was on this side but I only found this there

[http://www.ndl.go.jp/incunabula/e/font/0543-t02.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624093940/http:/www.ndl.go.jp/incunabula/e/font/0543-t02.html "http://www.ndl.go.jp/incunabula/e/font/0543-t02.html")

Thank you very much :)

_I assume their Subiaco type is appearing toward the end of your essay?_

I try to make a timeline and this would be the point where I split it in 2 directions.

Steven

Just for an added boost, call it the "type road," as that is what it was. FYI: Subiaco also now means "sanctuary." Probably the most exciting point in type history. Perfect choice.

Gerald  
 [http://BielerPress.blogspot.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100624093940/http:/bielerpress.blogspot.com/ "http://BielerPress.blogspot.com")
